t: Deuteronomy 32
The Song of Moses
“Give*pn ear, O heavens, and let me speak; And*ln let the earth hear the words of my mouth.
Let*ln my teaching drop as the rain, My*ln speech distill as the dew, As*ln the droplets on the fresh grass And*ln as the showers on the herb.
For*ln I proclaim the name of the Lord;*s Ascribe*ln greatness to our God!
The*ln Rock! His work is perfect, For*ln all His ways are just; A*ln God of faithfulness and without injustice, Righteous*ln and upright is He.
They*ln have acted corruptly toward Him, They*iln are*i not His children, because of their defect; But*iln are*i a perverse and crooked generation.
Do*ln you thus repay the Lord,*s O*ln foolish and unwise people? Is*ln not He your Father who has bought you? He*ln has made you and established you.
Remember*ln the days of old, Consider*ln the years of all generations. Ask*ln your father, and he will inform you, Your*ln elders, and they will tell you.
When*ln the Most High gave the nations their inheritance, When*ln He separated the sons of man, He*ln set the boundaries of the peoples According*ln to the number of the sons of Israel.
For*ln the Lord’s*s portion is His people; Jacob*ln is the allotment of His inheritance.
He*ln found him in a desert land, And*ln in the howling waste of a wilderness; He*ln encircled him, He cared for him, He*ln guarded him as the pupil of His eye.
Like*ln an eagle that stirs up its nest, That*ln hovers over its young, He*ln spread His wings and caught them, He*ln carried them on His pinions.
The*ln Lord*s alone guided him, And*ln there was no foreign god with him.
He*ln made him ride on the high places of the earth, And*ln he ate the produce of the field; And*ln He made him suck honey from the rock, And*ln oil from the flinty rock,
Curds*ln of cows, and milk of the flock, With*ln fat of lambs, And*ln rams, the breed of Bashan, and goats, With*ln the finest of the wheat— And*ln of the blood of grapes you drank wine.
“But*ln Jeshurun grew fat and kicked— You*ln are grown fat, thick, and sleek— Then*ln he forsook God who made him, And*ln scorned the Rock of his salvation.
They*ln made Him jealous with strange gods;*i With*ln abominations they provoked Him to anger.
They*ln sacrificed to demons who were not God, To*ln gods whom they have not known, New*ln gods*i who came lately, Whom*ln your fathers did not dread.
You*ln neglected the Rock who begot you, And*ln forgot the God who gave you birth.
“The*ln Lord*s saw this,*i and spurned them*i Because*ln of the provocation of His sons and daughters.
Then*ln He said, ‘I will hide My face from them, I*ln will see what their end shall*i be;*i For*ln they are a perverse generation, Sons*ln in whom is no faithfulness.

They*ln have made Me jealous with what*i is not God; They*ln have provoked Me to anger with their idols. So*ln I will make them jealous with those*i who*i are not a people; I*ln will provoke them to anger with a foolish nation,
For*ln a fire is kindled in My anger, And*ln burns to the lowest part of Sheol, And*ln consumes the earth with its yield, And*ln sets on fire the foundations of the mountains.
‘I*ln will heap misfortunes on them; I*ln will use My arrows on them.
They*iln will*i be*i wasted by famine, and consumed by plague And*ln bitter destruction; And*ln the teeth of beasts I will send upon them, With*ln the venom of crawling things of the dust.
Outside*ln the sword will bereave, And*ln inside terror— Both*ln young man and virgin, The*ln nursling with the man of gray hair.
I*ln would have said, “I will cut them to pieces, I*ln will remove the memory of them from men,”
Had*ln I not feared the provocation by the enemy, That*ln their adversaries would misjudge, That*ln they would say, “Our hand is triumphant, And*ln the Lord*s has not done all this.” ’
“For*ln they are a nation lacking in counsel, And*ln there is no understanding in them.
Would*ln that they were wise, that they understood this, That*ln they would discern their future!
How*ln could one chase a thousand, And*ln two put ten thousand to flight, Unless*ln their Rock had sold them, And*ln the Lord*s had given them up?
Indeed*ln their rock is not like our Rock, Even*ln our enemies themselves judge this.
For*ln their vine is from the vine of Sodom, And*ln from the fields of Gomorrah; Their*ln grapes are grapes of poison, Their*ln clusters, bitter.
Their*ln wine is the venom of serpents, And*ln the deadly poison of cobras.
‘Is*ln it not laid up in store with Me, Sealed*ln up in My treasuries?
Vengeance*ln is Mine, and retribution, In*ln due time their foot will slip; For*ln the day of their calamity is near, And*ln the impending things are hastening upon them.’
For*ln the Lord*s will vindicate His people, And*ln will have compassion on His servants, When*ln He sees that their*i strength is gone, And*ln there is none remaining,*i bond or free.
And*ln He will say, ‘Where are their gods, The*ln rock in which they sought refuge?
Who*ln ate the fat of their sacrifices, And*iln drank the wine of their drink offering? Let*ln them rise up and help you, Let*ln them be your hiding place!
See*ln now that I, I am He, And*ln there is no god besides Me; It*ln is I who put to death and give life. I*ln have wounded and it is I who heal, And*ln there is no one who can deliver from My hand.
Indeed,*ln I lift up My hand to heaven, And*ln say, as I live forever,
If*ln I sharpen My flashing sword, And*ln My hand takes hold on justice, I*ln will render vengeance on My adversaries, And*ln I will repay those who hate Me.
I*ln will make My arrows drunk with blood, And*ln My sword will devour flesh, With*ln the blood of the slain and the captives, From*ln the long-haired leaders of the enemy.’
Rejoice,*ln O nations, with*i His people; For*ln He will avenge the blood of His servants, And*ln will render vengeance on His adversaries, And*ln will atone for His land and*i His people.”
Then*p Moses came and spoke all the words of this song in the hearing of the people, he, with Joshua the son of Nun.
When Moses had finished speaking all these words to all Israel,
he said to them, “Take to your heart all the words with which I am warning you today, which you shall command your sons to observe carefully, even*i all the words of this law.
For it is not an idle word for you; indeed it is your life. And by this word you will prolong your days in the land, which you are about to cross the Jordan to possess.”
The*p Lord*s spoke to Moses that very same day, saying,
“Go up to this mountain of the Abarim, Mount Nebo, which is in the land of Moab opposite Jericho, and look at the land of Canaan, which I am giving to the sons of Israel for a possession.
Then die on the mountain where you ascend, and be gathered to your people, as Aaron your brother died on Mount Hor and was gathered to his people,
because you broke faith with Me in the midst of the sons of Israel at the waters of Meribah-kadesh, in the wilderness of Zin, because you did not treat Me as holy in the midst of the sons of Israel.
For you shall see the land at a distance, but you shall not go there, into the land which I am giving the sons of Israel.”
